The recent availability of microarray technology has made it possible to perform an extensive analysis of IL-1 modulation of genes in cells that are central players in arthritic disease.
However, the most likely explanation for the low level of induction seen here is the fact that MMPs are not 'early response genes'.
Furthermore, our microarray data demonstrated that IL-1 inhibited Col2A1 expression by 1.6-fold in SW1353 cells (data not shown).

Surprisingly, egr-1 expression was increased only 1.3-fold in this Human Cancer 1.2 K array (data not shown).
This suggests that in IL-1-stimulated chondrocytes, NF-?B family members may compete for dimerization partners and for binding sites in responsive genes.
Members of the NF-?B, AP-1, and ets families of transcription factors substantially increased in the Human Cancer 1.2 K array (see Table 2, panel A).
